content.question: Toward the end of the final paragraph, Conradin’s “exchange” of “a long-secreted hoard of small silver” with the butcher-boy is significant because it

choices.label: reveals the great store of wealth to which Conradin has access
develops the idea that Conradin finds joy in acts that would be displeasing to Mrs. De Ropp
establishes the fact that Conradin has meaningful and well-established friendships
underscores Conradin’s main desire to live on the margins of society, ignoring its rules and customs

content.answer: develops the idea that Conradin finds joy in acts that would be displeasing to Mrs. De Ropp

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain the function of a significant event or related set of significant events in a plot.
